events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle struck by another driver at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision and damages reported.
An agent was assigned promptly to the customer's case to ensure timely processing of the auto accident claim.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the vehicle accident is registered in the system.
The customer was asked to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license for further evaluation.
Documents including accident photos, police report, and insurance information were submitted by the customer promptly.
The investigation of the vehicle collision details and verification of damages has begun with assigned adjusters.
The investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault, and all vehicle damage estimates were verified.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement terms and indicated willingness to proceed.
The claim was officially approved based on investigation results and customer acceptance of the settlement.
The payment for the claim settlement was processed and sent to the customer's bank account successfully.
After payment completion, the claim case was officially closed with a confirmation sent to the customer.
The claim file was archived in the system for records and future reference, marking the end of the process.
